description:
Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) is an educational program that teaches the history and mechanics of the financial markets using insights from the Bloomberg Terminal. 

BMC was specifically made for avid investors and people who are interested in understanding the dynamics of the financial markets. The course emphasizes a practitioner's approach to understanding the financial markets, utilizing tools and data primarily accessible to institutional investors and traders (i.e. data, news, and analytics from the Bloomberg Terminal). If you have access to the Bloomberg Terminal, it may be helpful to follow along, but it is not necessary to grasp the content.

In this course, you will learn the pillars of the world economic markets: Economic Indicators and Currencies. 

First, we will cover the main economic indicators that investors follow and explain how to interpret them to help forecast the market. You will learn: 

  • The importance of GDP to investors and how they monitor and forecast GDP
  • How to use economical indicators to gauge the health of the economy
  • The qualities of good economic indicators and the 5 main indicators to forecast the US market.

Second, we will cover how the world currency markets operate and explain the three main drivers of currency valuation. You will learn: 

  • How economic surprises influence and move the currency markets 
  • How central banks protect from inflation and deflation 
  • How investors and businesses manage currency risk

We hope you enjoy this introduction to the financial markets and find value in seeing the world economy via the Bloomberg Terminal.
title: Bloomberg Market Concepts: Economic Indicators & Currencies
